intro: Morisonia johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's morisonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
